py-trelliscope
  • Serialization API
  • Edit on GitHub

Serialization APIïƒ

JSON serialization for trelliscope display specifications.

Core Functionsïƒ

Display Infoïƒ

trelliscope.serialize_display_info(display)[source]ïƒ

Serialize Display to displayInfo.json format.

This produces the JSON specification consumed by trelliscopejs-lib viewer.

Parameters:

display (Display) â€“ Display object to serialize.

Returns:

Dictionary matching displayInfo.json schema.

Return type:

dict

Examples

>>> from trelliscope import Display
>>> import pandas as pd
>>>
>>> df = pd.DataFrame({"value": [1, 2, 3]})
>>> display = Display(df, name="example")
>>> display.infer_metas()
>>>
>>> info = serialize_display_info(display)
>>> info["name"]
'example'
trelliscope.write_display_info(display, output_path)[source]ïƒ

Write displayInfo.json file for Display.

Parameters:

  • display (Display) â€“ Display object to serialize.

  • output_path (Path) â€“ Output directory path. File will be written to output_path/displayInfo.json.

Returns:

Path to written displayInfo.json file.

Return type:

Path

Raises:

OSError â€“ If directory cannot be created or file cannot be written.

Examples

>>> from trelliscope import Display
>>> from pathlib import Path
>>>
>>> display = Display(df, name="example")
>>> output = Path("./output")
>>>
>>> json_path = write_display_info(display, output)
>>> print(json_path)
output/displayInfo.json

Metadata Filesïƒ

trelliscope.serialization.write_metadata_json(display, output_path)[source]ïƒ

Write metaData.json file with cogData array.

This file contains the same cogData as embedded in displayInfo.json, but with relative panel paths like â€œpanels/0.pngâ€.

Parameters:

  • display (Display) â€“ Display object to serialize.

  • output_path (Path) â€“ Output directory path. File will be written to output_path/metaData.json.

Returns:

Path to written metaData.json file.

Return type:

Path

Raises:

OSError â€“ If file cannot be written.

trelliscope.serialization.write_metadata_js(display, output_path)[source]ïƒ

Write metaData.js file with window.metaData wrapper.

This file is REQUIRED by trelliscopejs-lib viewer even when cogData is embedded in displayInfo.json. It must contain: window.metaData = [â€¦];

Parameters:

  • display (Display) â€“ Display object to serialize.

  • output_path (Path) â€“ Output directory path. File will be written to output_path/metaData.js.

Returns:

Path to written metaData.js file.

Return type:

Path

Raises:

OSError â€“ If file cannot be written.

Utilitiesïƒ

trelliscope.serialize_to_json_string(display, indent=2)[source]ïƒ

Serialize Display to JSON string.

Parameters:

  • display (Display) â€“ Display object to serialize.

  • indent (int, default=2) â€“ JSON indentation level.

Returns:

JSON string representation.

Return type:

str

Examples

>>> json_str = serialize_to_json_string(display)
>>> print(json_str)
{
  "name": "example",
  ...
}

JSON Schemaïƒ

displayInfo.json Structureïƒ

The main display configuration file follows this schema:

{
  "name": "display_name",
  "description": "Display description",
  "keysig": "unique_key_signature",
  "n": 10,
  "height": 500,
  "width": 500,
  "tags": [],
  "keycols": [],
  "metas": [
    {
      "varname": "category",
      "label": "Category",
      "type": "factor",
      "levels": ["A", "B", "C"]
    }
  ],
  "cogInterface": {
    "name": "display_name",
    "group": "common",
    "type": "JSON"
  },
  "cogInfo": {},
  "cogDistns": {},
  "cogData": [],
  "state": {
    "layout": {"ncol": 3, "nrow": 2},
    "labels": ["category"],
    "filters": [],
    "sorts": []
  },
  "views": [],
  "panelInterface": {
    "type": "file",
    "base": "panels",
    "panelCol": "panel"
  }
}

metaData.json Structureïƒ

Separate metadata file for viewer:

[
  {
    "panelKey": "0",
    "panel": "panels/0.png",
    "category": "A",
    "value": 10
  }
]

metaData.js Structureïƒ

JavaScript wrapper for browser loading:

window.metaData = [
  {
    "panelKey": "0",
    "panel": "panels/0.png",
    "category": "A",
    "value": 10
  }
];

Panel Interface Typesïƒ

File-Based Panelsïƒ

{
  "panelInterface": {
    "type": "file",
    "base": "panels",
    "panelCol": "panel"
  }
}

Iframe Panels (HTML)ïƒ

{
  "panelInterface": {
    "type": "iframe",
    "base": "panels",
    "panelCol": "panel"
  }
}

REST API Panelsïƒ

{
  "panelInterface": {
    "type": "rest",
    "baseUrl": "http://localhost:5001/api/panels",
    "panelCol": "panel"
  }
}

Examplesïƒ

Custom Serializationïƒ

from trelliscope import Display, serialize_display_info

display = Display(df, name="example")
display.set_panel_column("plot")

# Serialize to dict
config = serialize_display_info(display)

# Modify config
config['state']['layout']['ncol'] = 5

# Write to file
import json
with open('custom_config.json', 'w') as f:
    json.dump(config, f, indent=2)

Direct JSON Outputïƒ

from trelliscope import serialize_to_json_string

display = Display(df, name="example")
json_str = serialize_to_json_string(display)

# Use in API response
return Response(json_str, mimetype='application/json')

Validationïƒ

from trelliscope import write_display_info
from pathlib import Path

display = Display(df, name="example")

# Write with validation
try:
    write_display_info(display, Path("output"))
except ValueError as e:
    print(f"Invalid configuration: {e}")
